articleBody: A small meteorite crashed into a wooded area in Nicaragua's capital of Managua overnight.<n>Residents reported hearing a mysterious boom that left a 16-foot deep crater.<n>Asteroid 2014 RC, which measured 60 feet in diameter, skimmed the Earth this weekend.
A female passenger dressed in a hazmat suit was spotted Wednesday waiting for a flight at the airport.<n>The JCPenney bag - maybe that's a new business line for the bankrupt retailer.

Two Australians say they bought a Quarter Pounder with cheese for a friend in 1995.<n>The friend never showed up, so the burger went uneaten.<n>"We’re pretty sure it’s the oldest burger in the world," one of the men says.

ISIS supporters announced that the group’s youngest soldier has died in combat.<n>One Twitter account said the boy was killed in a U.S. air strike, though that has not been confirmed.<n>ISIS supporters identified the boy as Abu Ubaidah.

A ceasefire agreement between Boko Haram and the Nigerian government was expected to lead to the liberation of more than 200 schoolgirls kidnapped by the militants six months ago.<n>Boko Haram has not confirmed the truce.<n>There have been at least six attacks over the weekend – blamed by security sources on the insurgents – that have killed several dozen people since the announcement of the ceasefire.
The Nobel Committee doesn't'regret' giving President Obama the Peace Prize.<n>There is no-shattering thing as a 'pumpkin-spice-flavored condom'<n>No one expects'record-shattering snowfall' this year.

NEW: NASA blogger: "Lack of fireball reports... suggests some other cause"<n>A meteorite crashes into woods in Managua, Nicaragua.<n>The crater is 39 feet (12 meters) across.<n>No damage or injuries were reported.

Amazon is planning to launch an ad-supported streaming video service early next year, the New York Post reports.<n>The service would be separate from Amazon's $99 yearly Prime membership.<n>Amazon Instant Video has established itself as the second largest paid streaming video service.

Father John Micheal O'Neal, 71, suffered a massive heart attack.<n>He reportedly went to heaven and met a 'warm and comforting' God.<n>He woke up 48 hours later and has recovered from the heart attack.
Canadian media is reporting that a soldier has been wounded in the attack.<n>Heavily armed police are racing to seal off the building and the office of Canadian Prime Minister Stephen Harper.

U.S. military officials say they are investigating claims that Islamic State fighters seized a cache of weapons that were airdropped by U.S.-led coalition forces.<n>A video uploaded by a media group showed a cache of weapons including hand grenades, ammunition and rocket-propelled grenade launchers.<n>The supplies were airdropped early Monday to Kurds in the embattled Syrian town of Kobani.

Cassy, aka @NessLovnTrey247 (she really likes Trey Songz), claims she found out her boyfriend was cheating.<n>She printed out the evidence, wrapped it up, and gave it to him as a present.<n>Although she shamed her dude on Snapchat and Twitter, she hasn't posted that video.

Kai the shar pei-crossbreed was discovered tied to a railing at Ayr station.<n>He was accompanied by a case containing a pillow, toy, food and bowl.<n>The dog was sold on the Gumtree website in 2013 and the charity is appealing for information to help trace whoever bought him.

An article on Huzlers.com says NASA confirmed six days of darkness in December.<n>It uses fake quotes from a NASA official.<n>The site has a disclaimer that says it's not real and shouldn't ever be taken seriously.
Italian fisherman Dino Ferrari landed what could potentially be a world record wels catfish.<n>The fish measured an incredible 8.7 feet in length and weighed 280 pounds.

HBO's subscription streaming service will be called HBO Now and is expected to cost $15 per month.<n>The report says HBO is targeting a launch for Now in early April, ahead of the start date for Game of Thrones.<n>Last year, HBO's online streaming option for cable subscribers, HBO Go, wouldn't work for many who were trying to watch during the premiere.

A woman named Taylor Lianne Chandler has spoken out about her alleged relationship with Michael Phelps.<n>Chandler says she was born intersex and met the Olympic swimmer on Tinder.<n>She says they had sex on their first date watching a football game.
Macaulay Culkin is not dead.<n>The actor is just next victim in a long line of Hollywood death hoaxes.<n>A Facebook page was made to memorialize the actor.

Sheikh Mohammed Saleh al-Munajjid: "It is not permitted to make a statue out of snow"<n>Sheikh Munajjid: To build a snowman was to create an image of a human being.<n>Twitter users: "They are afraid for their faith of everything... sick minds"

Eran Cicurel, an editor at Voice of Israel, has quoted YPG fighters saying that Gill Rosenberg was not captured by IS.<n>The YPG fighters noted, through Cicurel, that Rosenberg was not in the city of Hoban at the time that IS claims she was abducted.<n>It is illegal for an Israeli citizen to travel to an Israeli-declared hostile state, including Iraq and Syria, for any reason including business and media reporting.

Mother called 9-1-1 when she found her son in his room, watching pornography and masturbating.<n>Now the teenager is being held without bail and charged by prosecutors under a new controversial Arizona state law called 'Self-Rape'<n>This is the first time this new state law has been used since it was put into action last month by Arizona Governor Jan Brewer.

Abdel-Majed Abdel Bary, 24, is a former West London rapper who performed under the name L Jinny.<n>A former hostage said Bary is one of several jihadists nicknamed "The Beatles" because of their British accents.<n>"We have not identified who the man in the video is at this time," a representative from Scotland Yard told Billboard.

Lebanese security officials said they had detained Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi's wife and son.<n>But Iraq's government later insisted the woman was not married to Baghdadi.<n>It said the woman - identified as Saja al-Dulaimi - was the daughter of an active member of al-Qaeda's affiliate in Syria, al-Nusra Front.<n>She is also thought to have been detained by the Syrian authorities before being freed in March as part of a prisoner exchange with al-Nusra.

The FBI has questioned a man who says he recorded gunfire, his attorney says.<n>In the recording, a quick series of shots can be heard, followed by a pause.<n>A forensic audio expert says he detected at least 10 gunshots.

Abdel-Majed Abdel Bary, who went by the rap name L. Jinny or Lyricist Jinn, is a suspect in the beheading of journalist James Foley this week.<n>Bary, 24, is said to have left home last year to join rebels in Syria.<n>Ex-ISIS hostages have said that he has the nickname “John the Beatle” because of his British accent.

AK Verma, an executive engineer at the Central Public Works Department, was fired after last appearing for work in December 1990.<n>Even after an inquiry found him guilty of "wilful absence from duty" in 1992, it took another 22 years and the intervention of a cabinet minister to remove him.<n>India's labour laws, which the World Bank says are the most restrictive anywhere, make it hard to sack staff for any reason other than criminal misconduct.

The Met Police has denied reports that street artist Banksy was arrested on Monday.<n>A Met spokesperson said the force did not have any information of such arrest and even if they had, it was possible they would not publish a press release about it.<n>A fake press release initially published by PR Log has been taken down.

Young North Korean dictator Kim Jong Un’s health is just fine, his government said Thursday evening.<n>It was said Kim Yo Jong had taken over while her brother underwent medical treatment.<n>It has been rumored Kim, 31, might have had ankle surgery, but So Se Pyong said that is incorrect.

According to a French website, the Apple Watch will start at around $500 for the steel model.<n>According to iGen.fr, the stainless steel Apple Watch in polished steel or black will cost $500 when it debuts close to Valentine’s Day of 2015.<n>The gold Apple Watch in yellow or pink gold would cost between $4,000 and $5,000 when it goes on sale in January.

The small town of Purdon, Texas has been quarantined after a family of five tested positive for the Ebola virus.<n>It has been verified that Jack Phillips returned from Dallas last week while on business.<n>CDC quarantined the area, erecting road blocks and disallowing anyone in or out of the area.

The incident occurred during a joint helicopter raid in Afghanistan in 2013.<n>A bullet, presumably from a sniper, cracks against the helmet of one of the soldiers.<n>Complaining that their ears are ringing, they inspect the helmet before resolving to find out where the sniper is located.

Zack Snyder recently unveiled an official photo of the Batmobile from "Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice"<n>But immediately after came word that one of the Batmobiles has been stolen.<n>Warner Bros never confirmed the report and its still unclear whether the vehicle was ever stolen.

New York Mayor Bill de Blasio is set to change the city's marijuana policy.<n>Those caught with a small amount of weed would be issued a court summons.<n>The shift could have a huge impact in black and Latino communities.

Banksy’s real name is Paul Horner, a 35-year old male born in Liverpool, England.<n>London Police Chief Lyndon Edwards held a press conference to answer questions about Banksy.<n>Horner is currently being held without bail on charges of vandalism, conspiracy, racketeering and counterfeiting.

A source in Kansas City confirmed the story to the Gateway Pundit.<n>A Nigerian woman was taken to the hospital with a high fever and Ebola like symptoms.<n>Her apartment building was quarantined, though that may have been lifted later.

Letter is believed to have been included in a 1974 Lego box set.<n>It was addressed to parents and said: 'The urge to create is equally strong in all children... boys and girls'<n>Image was posted on reddit.com and has been shared widely since.<n>A spokesperson for Lego was not immediately available for comment.

The nun, who came to Italy from South America, had no idea she was pregnant.<n>She was taken to hospital by her sisters, where doctors quickly told her she was pregnant.<n>The baby is healthy and the nun’s convent has expressed an interest in taking care of him.

Intelligence reports have detailed the types of aircraft believed seized.<n>Several have the size and range to reach deep into Europe and Africa.<n>Libya is witnessing its worst violence since former dictator Muammar al-Gaddafi was toppled and killed in 2011.

Man was accused of pinning a young girl to a wall and attempting to rape her.<n> vigilantes dragged him into a butchery and used a meat cleaver to cut off his penis.<n>Remains were discarded in the street beside the man, who was suffering from severe blood loss.<n>Incidents of rape in India have gone up tenfold in the last 40 years.

Footage shows a 'bear-like' figure covered in hair emerging from snow-covered trees in the south-western Adygeya Republic.<n>A team had set out in search of the mysterious creature after local television reported that it had been sighted.<n>They claim they heard crunching of snow as they headed out to investigate before capturing footage of the creature.

The video circulated on Tuesday showed a masked Isis fighter beheading a kneeling man.<n>It is purported to be James Foley, a photojournalist who went missing in Syria in 2012.<n>The White House said it was working to establish the video's authenticity.<n>If it was genuine, the US would be 'appalled by the brutal murder'
Source says Kim hurt his leg while inspecting military exercises.<n>He needs about 100 days to recuperate, said the source.<n>Kim was absent from a September 25 meeting of parliament.

Nigeria says it has struck a cease-fire deal with Boko Haram.<n>The deal raises hopes that over 200 schoolgirls kidnapped by the militant group will be released.<n>But mystery continues to surround the identity of the interlocutor on the other side of the negotiations.

North Korean leader Kim Jong-un had surgery in Pyongyang in mid-September to treat fractures to both ankles.<n>Kim is around 170 cm tall and has become noticeably overweight since he came to power.<n>There has been speculation that his obesity and binge drinking brought on gout.<n>Kim missed a regular session of the Supreme People's Assembly in Pyongyang on Thursday.

McDonald's will be phasing out 8 menu items the beginning of next year.<n>One notable "ingredient" – preservatives – might also be eliminated from the menu altogether.<n>McDonald's is currently testing out a new version of their slim down menu in Delaware, Little Rock, Waco, Bakersfield, Macon and Knoxville.<n>They plan a full nationwide rollout beginning February 1, 2015.

The KFC Corporation was approved on February 3, 2015 for their Marijuana Retail Recreational Pot / Medical Marijuana Occupational Business License.<n>Currently, 42 of the nearly 100 KFC franchises in the state of Colorado have added this “option” to their menu.<n>Marijuana may be purchased only by adults 21 years or older, and a picture ID is required.<n>Coloradans may buy 1 ounce at a time, while out-of-state residents are limited to a quarter ounce.<n>Prices begin around $200 and up per ounce along with a 25% marijuana tax.

eBay has posted an ad listing, looking for a developer to help them come up with a bidding app for the Apple Watch.<n>The ad says that it is looking for a dev to join eBay’s New Technology Group, which operates out of Portland with over 200 engineers.<n>That seems to indicate that whatever presence the eBay app has on the Apple Watch, it will tie into the core iPhone app.

Sources say Sony is beginning negotiations with The Fighter actor.<n>The move comes after Bale's talks with Fox to star in 'The Deep Blue Goodbye' hit a roadblock.<n>Danny Boyle is directing the untitled Jobs film, which is based on Walter Isaacson's book and adapted by Aaron Sorkin.

At least one of five Taliban militants released in exchange for U.S. soldier Bowe Bergdahl made contact with the Taliban.<n>There was no indication the former prisoner, being held in Qatar, made contact with the Taliban.<n>"We're closely monitoring the situation and see no potential threat," a senior U.S. official said.

HBO is in talks with Apple over a partnership that would see its upcoming web-only subscription television package available on the Apple TV.<n>The service, which may be called "HBO Now," will allow users to access HBO content without a cable subscription for a set monthly fee.<n>HBO's web-only subscription will launch in April alongside the premiere of the fifth season of Game of Thrones.

The Department of Homeland Security has repeatedly said that the assertion that ISIS-affiliated terrorists were arrested while crossing the U.S.-Mexico border is false.<n>But the vice president of the largest union representing Border Patrol agents told BuzzFeed News on Thursday that DHS is incorrect.<n>And he said, the incident highlights the need for more funding for the Border Patrol.

Ahmed Abdi Godane is believed among six people killed in a U.S. airstrike on two cars near the al-Shabab stronghold of Barawe.<n>Godane is al-Shabab's spiritual leader under whose direction the Somali militants forged an alliance with al-Qaida and became the most high-profile terrorist group in Africa.<n>In 2012, the U.S. government put a $7million price on Godane's head - though he has escaped justice until now.

A rumour has been circulating that a Batmobile has been stolen from the set of Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice.<n>The film is currently filming in Detroit and Zack Snyder is the director.<n>The Detroit Free Press have confirmed that the Batmobile is safe in the Batcave where it belongs.

Sharing boy magnet elementary school pupil Vodyaninskoy Nicholas Kruglyachenko.<n>Seven year old superhero abilities Nick discovered his chance.<n>Experts still can not figure out exactly how they do it.

Instagram user andreysmygov posted a photo of a spray-painted penis on a $2.5 million Bugatti Veyron.<n>The photo was posted with the caption, "How often do [yo]u get to spray paint on a Bugatti lol"<n>The Instagram user credited the TwinzTV YouTube channel and crew, who posted photos of the vehicle mentioning a prank.

Pope Francis declared there was a place in heaven for the creatures we share our lives with.<n>His comment was reported this week by many news media outside Italy, with dozens of articles in the United States.<n>It turned out the pope had not made the comment.<n>Pope Paul VI, who died in 1978, reportedly said, "one day we will see our animals in the eternity of Christ"

There was some speculation as to what Mike Seidel was or was not doing.<n>Brian Williams issued a statement Monday night to clear up the confusion.<n>Williams: "It was just Mike working to make it right -- which is why we all love working with Mike Seidel"

James Wright Foley went missing in on November 22, 2012, while reporting from Syria.<n>A shocking video apparently shows the 40-year-old being beheaded by IS.<n>The militant group is now also threatening to kill Time journalist Joel Sotloff.

The mob dragged Suresh Kumar to a butcher's shop and castrated him with a meat cleaver.<n>They then dumped his body parts and left him bleeding in the middle of the road.<n>The girl he was trying to rape is in shock and has been sent for counselling.
Gawker reports that the Vogue offices are infested.<n>Anna Wintour "must ensure that her personal office is rat-free before she enters it"

Original contents of the time capsule were first placed in 1795 by Governor Samuel Adams, Paul Revere, and William Scollay.<n>It was unearthed during emergency repairs to the foundation in 1855 and then buried again, and had not seen daylight until it emerged on Thursday.<n>Capsule believed to include a collection of silver and copper coins dating from between 1652 and 1855.

Bomb canisters packed with the venemous arachnids are being blasted into towns.<n>Former head of chemical and biological weapons for NATO described the arachnid attacks as'madness'<n>The 24in scorpion bombs are not used for mass casualties but instead designed to maximise the terrorist group's 'psychological impact' on the villagers.

The dedicated owner took his blocked-up 3-inch pet to a vet after realizing it was struggling to pass waste.<n>He was stunned to be told that the delicate operation needed to solve the problem would cost $460.<n>Vet Faye Bethell administered anesthetic to the fish, which was believed to be 2-years and 10-months old.<n>The 29-year-old then used a tiny scalpel to remove a lump which had grown close to its dorsal fin.

Lovesick Tan Shen, 26, went to the fast food chain in search of some comfort food to get over the break-up.<n>But seven days later Tan was still ordering chicken wings with a side of extra large fries at the KFC near a train station by her home.<n>She even phoned in sick to work to stay at the restaurant.

A sniper bullet hits a US marine on the helmet during a helicopter raid in Helmand Province, Afghanistan.<n>The video was uploaded to YouTube last month, and has since received just under 200,000 views.<n>Afghanistan veteran Sam Arnold reportedly said that the video was shot while "conducting a joint helicopter raid in the Now Zad district, Helmand Province in 2013"

Vice CEO Shane Smith reportedly spent $300,000 on a dinner in Las Vegas.<n>Vice is a cutting-edge media company that eschews tradition and even courts danger.<n>Smith has hinted at an IPO for Vice and guesses it could be worth $20 billion.

Robert Plant walked away from a 35-date tour that would have paid the rock group nearly $924 million.<n>British tycoon Sir Richard Branson had planned to reunite the Stairway to Heaven rockers.<n>The mega deal would have paid Plant, Jimmy Page and John Paul Jones roughly $346 million apiece, before taxes.
Tim Cook also gave a tentative time-frame as to when Apple Pay will be reaching Europe.<n>Analysts have predicted what Apple might offer at the time of its smartwatch launch.

Online news sites were subject to a hoax from US ‘media troll extaordinaire’<n>Paul Horner, 39, had been identified as the street-artist known as Banksy.<n>He is in fact editor of the cunningly-named Super Official News website.

Homeland Security Secretary Jeh Johnson tried to dispel rumors and dial back fears.<n>He said the number of unaccompanied minors apprehended in fiscal year 2014 was 68,434.<n>Claims that four terrorists had crossed the border were false, he said, and the government is intensifying efforts to keep Ebola out of the U.S.

Users are taking to Twitter to claim that the smartphone is catching hairs from people’s heads and beards and pulling them out.<n> hairs get stuck in the fine seam between the glass and the aluminium on the new handsets.<n>Apple says it has only received a handful of official complaints about the issue.

Williams is at a center of a media firestorm after he was found out for embellishing an old war story about being in a helicopter hit by a grenade during the Iraq war in 2003.<n>The newscaster acted swiftly on Wednesday night to attempt to diffuse the situation by apologizing during his Nightly News show.<n>But since then a series of ex-soldiers have come forward to criticize Williams 'half-hearted' apology.<n>Now it transpires that NBC News executives - and Tom Brokaw - had known for years that the story was false.<n>'Tom Brokaw and [former NBC News President

An alarm box near the front entrance of the White House had been muted at what officers believed was a request of the usher’s office.<n>The female officer posted inside the front door appeared to be delayed in learning that the intruder, Omar Gonzalez, was about to burst through.<n>Gonzalez was tackled by a counter-assault agent at the far southern end of the East Room.

Mark Oberholtzer’s former Ford F-250 pick-up truck, complete with anti-aircraft gun, was used in a propaganda stunt by Supporters of the Religion Front (Jabhat Ansar al-Deen) in the Syrian civil war.<n>Oberholtzer has run the company for 32 years and said he took the truck to an dealership three years ago.<n>He believed that the dealership would remove the decal off the vehicle before sale.

Afghanistan veteran Sam Arnold uploaded this spine-chilling video of a US Marine getting a direct headshot from a Taliban sniper.<n>Arnold: "The Marines were conducting a joint helicopter raid in the Now Zad district, Helmand Province in 2013"<n>The shot occurs right at the :45 mark in the video.

The woman, who belonged to an order in Macerata, Italy, was rushed to hospital by her fellow sisters.<n>The nun, who is originally from South America, said she had no idea she was pregnant when she was rushed to hospital in agony.<n>The baby was born healthy but remains in hospital to undergo further checks.

Kim Jong Un has not been seen in public for more than a month.<n>North Korea's state media has not made any mention of his activities.<n>Source said that Kim hurt his leg while inspecting military exercises.
Rudd was at Dallas-Fort Worth International Airport on a connecting flight from Kansas City.<n>He was one of the onlookers who rushed to the defense of a man attacked by an antigay bigot.

Mark-1 Plumbing in Texas City has been flooded with calls after the picture appeared on Twitter.<n>The photo shows a black pickup truck with a Mark-1 Plumbing decal on the door and an anti-aircraft gun in the bed.<n>Owner Mark Oberholtzer said he traded that truck at an AutoNation dealership three years ago and has no idea how it ended up in Syria.
Attorney Lopa Blumenthal says the recording was made during a video chat.<n>Blumenthal says the man who made the recording has spoken to the FBI.

Deandre Joshua, 20, was shot in the head and burned inside his car.<n>He was a childhood friend of Dorian Johnson, who was with Michael Brown the night he was killed.<n>It is unclear who killed Joshua or why they did so, but it is clear his death was not retaliation for grand jury testimony in the Brown case.

The Bugatti Veyron 16.4 Grand Sport is the world’s most expensive production car.<n>The car boasts 1,200 horse power, tops out at 252.97 miles per hour.<n>If you can afford one of these, you can probably afford a new paint job.

ISIS sympathisers take to social media to identify 'cub fighter' by his alleged nom de guerre Abu Ubaidah.<n>He is said to have died fighting alongside his father in Syria in recent weeks, but not specified where they died or who they were fighting against.<n>Describing the child as ISIS' youngest jihadist, chilling photographs taken before his alleged death show him smiling at the camera.<n>One image shows him standing inside a house, grinning as he struggles to hold an assault rifle so large that it threatens to topple him.

The Apple Watch was unveiled alongside the iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 Plus on September 9.<n>Analyst Timothy Arcuri of Cowen and Company claims to have narrowed down a significant proportion of the specifications.<n>The Apple Watch is also being tipped to come in 4GB and 8GB variants.<n>The report speculates that either Apple has used a modified version of the chipset, or disabled GPS functionality for better battery life.

Social media around the world have been flooded with rumors of Fidel Castro's death.<n>There was no sign Friday that the reports were true, even if he has not been seen in public for months.<n>Similar speculation has swept across Cuban expatriate communities repeatedly over the decades.

Condé Nast and Vogue recently decamped from Times Square to the new digs at One World Trade Center.<n>According to insiders, the pesky rodents have invaded the infamous accessories closet and left droppings on desks, computers, and pricey couture.<n>Anna Wintour has told assistants that her pristine office must be rat-free before she enters.

Rep. Duncan D. Hunter said ISIS fighters have been caught crossing into the U.S. from Mexico.<n>Homeland Security Secretary Jeh Johnson shot down Hunter's claims.<n>"We have no credible, specific intelligence to that effect," Johnson told CNN.

Snake wine helps men get their partners pregnant and improves the size of your manhood.<n>Kim, 31, and his wife Ri Jol-su, 22, are said to be having problems adding to their family because of his weight.<n>The ruler’s waistline has expanded because of his love of imported French cheese and Johnnie Walker whisky.

The couple couldn't have wished for a better Christmas present when it was revealed they wouldn't have to worry about their house payments anymore.<n>A LiveLeak video showed their son casually taking out a letter after telling his parents he had a gift for them.

30-year-old Moscow resident was hospitalized with wounds very intimate nature.<n>In the hands of doctors, the man complained that his casual acquaintance opoila in the sauna, and then gently held his castration operation.<n>At the hospital, the man hours spent in intensive care, doctors were forced to spend a second operation on the testicles.

Rumors spread on Twitter that Nelson had died of a drug overdose.<n>His agent tweeted out a photo of Nelson holding today's paper.<n>The actor's agent also tweeted a photo of Nelson holding today's paper.

Isis has flown three captured jets over Aleppo, says Syrian Observatory for Human Rights.<n>Jets appeared to be MiG 21 or MiG23 models captured from Syrian military air base.<n>US-led air strikes against Isis in the besieged Syrian Kurdish city of Kobani have helped Kurdish fighters push back militants.

43 students went missing last month in the town of Iguala.<n>Authorities have begun digging up bodies and are trying to determine their identities.<n>Guerrero State Prosecutor Inaky Blanco says the graves were linked to the disappearance.

There have been reports that iOS 8 preferences are erasing iCloud files.<n>There have been reports that iOS 8 preferences are erasing iCloud files.<n>There have been reports that iOS 8 preferences are erasing iCloud files.

US drones are being flown over Isil's Syrian "capital" for the first time.<n>Residents of Raqqa have captured photo and video footage of the planes.<n>They are the same drones used in Pakistan and Yemen to attack terrorists.<n>The sightings are the clearest indication that President Obama has dramatically changed his policy.

Golf pro Dan Olsen made the allegations on a Michigan radio station Friday.<n>On Monday, Olsen said he was retracting his comments.<n>He also apologized to Woods, the PGA Tour, Nike and Commissioner Tim Finchem.<n>Woods announced last month he was taking an indefinite leave from golf.

The not-so-happy slapper allegedly struck again on Tuesday, this time launching an unprovoked attack on a frail 82-year-old woman.<n>Cumbria Police believe the man to be in his mid-to-late 50s and are urging anyone with information about either of the two attacks to come forward.

An unidentified man is said to have recorded the incident in which Michael Brown was shot by Officer Darren Wilson earlier this month.<n>In the recording, a quick series of shots can be heard, followed by a pause and then another quick succession of shots.<n>Forensic audio expert Paul Ginsberg analyzed the recording and said he detected at least 10 gunshots -- a cluster of six, followed by four.

Stan Beaton had kept the voicemail since his wife Ruby's death in 2003.<n>But technical work by Virgin Media meant it was deleted in December.<n>He said: "It's just a wonderful, wonderful sound that I thought was lost forever"

Boy, Nikolai Kryaglyachenko, discovered that he could attract metal items.<n>"Even when I do not want to do it, I still attract things," he said.<n>Nikolai can influence others so that people turn into live magnets as well.

Thousands of people have been duped by a fake news story claiming that Nasa has forecast a total blackout of earth for six days in December.<n>The story, entitled 'Nasa Confirms Earth Will Experience 6 Days of Total Darkness in December 2014!" originated from Huzlers.com.<n>The website has previously published a fake report about American rapper and actor Tupac Shakur, claiming that he is alive.

A former Comcast customer complained to Consumerist about false charges and billing issues.<n>Conal says he was fired from his job at a prestigious accounting firm.<n>Conal swears he never told anyone at Comcast where he worked.

The Chinese man went to his doctor complaining of stomach ache and itchy skin.<n>Scans revealed his entire body had been infected with tapeworm parasites.<n>Doctors believe some of the uncooked Japanese delicacy of raw meat or fish must have become contaminated.
Israeli authorities have opened a number of dams in the Gaza Valley.<n>More than 80 families have been evacuated from their homes.<n>This is not the first time the dams have been opened.

Tan Shen, 26, of Chengdu said she had not planned her extended stay in the fried chicken eatery but wound up there while wandering around depressed.<n>After three days in the 24-hour joint, the staffers noticed that the woman had not left.

Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak will be played onscreen by Seth Rogen in Aaron Sorkin’s upcoming Steve Jobs biopic.<n>Acting opposite Rogen will be Christian Bale as Jobs.<n>Sorkin’s screenplay for the film is based on Walter Isaacson’s biography, Steve Jobs.

Iraqi pilots who have joined Islamic State in Syria are training members of the group to fly in three captured fighter jets, a group monitoring the war said on Friday.<n>Canada is assembling a camp in Kuwait to launch its own air campaign over Iraq.<n>The government says Canada will be in a position to begin air strikes against Islamic State at some point within the last seven days of October.

Vice Media Inc. CEO Shane Smith sprung for the dinner following a lucky run at the casino’s blackjack tables.<n>MGM Resorts International Chairman Jim Murren cited the dinner bill as an "encouraging sign" that Las Vegas visitors were eager to spend money again.<n>A guest at the dinner, who asked not to be identified, told Bloomberg the dinner party was closer to 25.

Gold currently sells for between $1,200 and $1,300 per troy ounce and has been over $1,000 per troy ounce for the last five years.<n>18-karat gold contains 75% pure gold, and that term is regulated by law.<n>It’s pretty much impossible to find a gold watch for under $10,000 in any size and from any manufacturer.
Olsen: 'A credible person is telling me this. Well, it’s not testosterone but it’s something else'<n>'When it’s all said and done he’s going to surpass Lance Armstrong with infamy'

There are fresh fears of possible 9/11-style attacks taking place across North Africa.<n>Radical Islamist groups in Libya have reportedly seized nearly a dozen commercial airliners in the last month.<n>The aircraft were reportedly stolen in August after Islamists took control of the Tripoli International Airport.

Sen. Lindsey Graham says the Taliban detainees released in exchange for Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl have been in touch with members of the Haqqani network.<n>Graham: "Just as sure as we're sitting here, they're going back to the fight"<n>The Pentagon said Thursday that it is working with Qatar and is confident that any threat posed by the former detainees can be mitigated.
